abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings show a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. Lessons learned on sector
            policy, identify the importance of metering for a successful
            energy commercialization, highlighting that interventions
            should start at the point of interaction with end-customers,
            for distribution of electricity, gas, and heat. Moreover,
            since a small investment project is not an appropriate
            vehicle to implement major energy sector reforms, it does
            need to be supported, as in this case, by adjustment
            operations with significant energy sector reform components.
            Regarding lessons on country issues, it is worth noting that
            in this project, a multi-year Institutional Development Fund
            (IDF) for accounting reform, in addition to assistance from
            USAID, encouraged the Government to adopt national
            accounting standards, based on international standards, with
            training provided at the national level. It is thus
            suggested that during the country financial management
            assessment, consideration be given on whether to use an IDF
            grant, combined with funding from other donors. In addition,
            the importance of a competent Project Implementation Unit
            set at the early stages cannot be underestimated, evidenced
            by its strong, unifying role in the midst of continued
            staffing changes in implementing agencies, and line
            ministries, which could have somehow hindered implementation.
